Ed Miliband , the Labour leader, said: The cloud of allegations surrounding Andy Coulson 's tenure at the News of the World raised real questions about his ability to be at the heart of the Downing Street machine. He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier. I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long. Downing Street sources dismissed Labour's criticism and insisted the prime minister believed that Andy Coulson 's professionalism in sharpening up the Tories' media operation after his appointment in 2007 vindicated David Cameron 's original decision.
